name: create table
content:
CREATE TABLE table_name (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT,
  column1 VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  column2 INT,
  column3 DATE,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

name: insert data
content:
INSERT INTO table_name (column1, column2, column3,...)
VALUES (value1, value2, value3,...);

name: update data
content:
UPDATE table_name
SET column1 = value1,
  column2 = value2,
  ...
WHERE condition;

name: select data
content:
SELECT column1,
  column2,
...
FROM table_name
WHERE condition;

name: join table
content:
SELECT a.column1,
  b.column2,
...
FROM table1 a
  JOIN table2 b ON a.common_column = b.common_column
WHERE condition;

name: create index
content: CREATE INDEX index_name ON table_name (column1, column2,...);

name: add column
content:
ALTER TABLE table_name
ADD column_name datatype;

name: modify column
content:
ALTER TABLE table_name
MODIFY column_name datatype;

name: drop column
content: ALTER TABLE table_name DROP COLUMN column_name;

name: add a foreign key constraint
content:
ALTER TABLE table_name
ADD CONSTRAINT fk_name FOREIGN KEY (column_name) REFERENCES other_table (column_name);

name: create view
content:
CREATE VIEW view_name AS
SELECT column1,
  column2,
...
FROM table_name
WHERE condition;

name: aggregate functions
content:
SELECT column1,
  COUNT(*),
  AVG(column2)
FROM table_name
GROUP BY column1
HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

name: create stored procedure
content:
CREATE PROCEDURE procedure_name (parameter1 datatype, parameter2 datatype,...) BEGIN -- SQL statements
END;

name: create trigger
